intro: Tristania moultoniana, commonly known as the Moulton's tristania, is a flowering plant native to the island of Tristan da Cunha in the South Atlantic Ocean. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically elliptical and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Tristania moultoniana is adapted to the cool, maritime climate of its native habitat and is considered a rare and endemic species.
